description: Two French adventurers, Loic Voisot and Benjamin Humblot, have completed an extraordinary 16-country trek from France to Shanghai, walking nearly 12,850 kilometers over 518 days. Driven by environmental concerns and a desire for adventure, they overcame harsh winters and desert crossings to achieve their goal. The duo celebrated their arrival on the Bund, reflecting on their year-and-a-half-long journey.

title: Watch: PM Modi in Malaysia: Trade, trust and strategic partnership boost
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi begins a two-day visit to Malaysia, receiving a ceremonial welcome in Kuala Lumpur. Addressing the Indian diaspora, he says India is a trusted global partner for growth. Modi and Malaysian PM Anwar Ibrahim hold wide-ranging talks to boost cooperation in defence, trade, semiconductors, security and people-to-people ties under the Comprehensive Strategic Partnership.

description: Nearly 1,000 Google employees are demanding the company sever ties with the Department of Homeland Security, citing contracts with ICE and CBP. They allege Google's technology fuels "state violence and repression." The workers seek transparency on contracts, an immediate Q&A session, and assurances of safety for all employees, particularly those in vulnerable roles.

title: Govt spent barely 40% of Budget on biggest schemes in 9 months
description: Government spending on major schemes lags significantly, with only 41.2% of the budgeted amount disbursed in the first nine months. Revised estimates for 47 out of 53 large projects are lower than initially planned. Several key initiatives, including the Jal Jeevan Mission, show drastically reduced spending, raising concerns about project execution and fund utilization.

In this episode of HealthWrap, Ramya Kannan, Health Editor, The Hindu, speaks with Dr. Vinayak Shukla, Senior Consultant, Cardiovascular and Thoracic Surgery, Naruvi Hospitals, Vellore, about stress, its impact on health, and ways to manage it.

title: Elon Musk denies Starlink phone: CEO says no device in works
description: Elon Musk has officially denied reports of SpaceX developing a Starlink phone, stating "We are not developing a phone." This clarification comes amidst speculation about the satellite internet business's expansion ahead of a potential IPO. Musk has previously expressed strong reluctance towards phone manufacturing.
